Documentation for the Demand Project Boyie Chen 2022-09-30 About About the demand project The repository for Demand for Accounting Information (the project) is: https://github.com/cgmcclure/value_info About this documentation The documentation for the demand project (the docs) is structured to describe the usage of codes for the project. The github repository for the docs: https://github.com/boyiechen/RDocument Usage TBA 0.0.1 Set up on the server Make benefits from Cross Reference Click internal link to easily redirect to the page you would like to see. For example, please see Chapter 1 to view the structure of the code How to add/edit the documentation To Be Added Render the docs bookdown::render_book(input = "index.Rmd", output_format = "bookdown::gitbook", output_dir = "./../docs/") Preview book As you work, you may start a local server to live preview this HTML book. This preview will update as you edit the book when you save individual .Rmd files. You can start the server in a work session by using the RStudio add-in Preview book, or from the R console: bookdown::serve_book() Editing Reference Privacy and Sharing The docs will not publish any code detail to the public since it is made for the people who work under the project. Some function names, code snippets, and relations between scripts may be shown in the docs, while all full scripts should be displayed with links to the repository of the project to keep the docs up to date and prevent from data leaking.
Chapter 1 The structure of the codes Data Creation Analysis Knitting

Chapter 1 The structure of the codes In this chapter, we list the structure of the code for the project. Codes are categorized in the following categories by their usage: 1. data creation 2. analysis 1. data cleaning/manipulation 2. data merge 3. estimations 4. counterfactual analysis 3. table and figure knitting 1. summary statistics 2. regressions 3. histograms and other figures The following sections display the tree diagrams of the scripts, and show the dependencies of each script. Note that a .R file indicates a single script, and some features may require more than one script to realize. Project Folder analysis create_data drafts  figures  tables knit_tables Data Creation ## ./../../code/create_data ## +-- create_beta.R ## +-- create_compustat.R ## +-- create_final_stocks.R ## +-- create_stocks_monthly.R ## +-- index_membership.R ## \-- pull_wrds_data.R Analysis ## ./../../code/analysis ## +-- adjust_coeff.R ## +-- adjust_coeff_elasticity.R ## +-- adjust_coeff_set_average.R ## +-- bins.R ## +-- counterfactual_analysis_active.R ## +-- counterfactual_analysis_investor.R ## +-- counterfactual_cleaning_active.R ## +-- counterfactual_cleaning_coeff.R ## +-- counterfactual_cleaning_coeff_elasticity.R ## +-- counterfactual_cleaning_coeff_set_average.R ## +-- counterfactual_cleaning_investor.R ## +-- counterfactual_funcs.R ## +-- data0.R ## +-- data1.R ## +-- elasticities.R ## +-- estimate.R ## +-- gmm_estimation.R ## \-- readme.md TBA Knitting ## ./../../code/knit_tables ## +-- fig_elast_hist.Rnw ## +-- fig_gmm_coef_hist.Rnw ## +-- fig_mkt_chg_coeff.Rnw ## +-- fig_ols_coef_hist.Rnw ## +-- fig_quintile.Rnw ## +-- get_labels.R ## +-- get_label_values.R ## +-- get_stats.R ## +-- index_regress.Rnw ## +-- knit_tables.R ## +-- readme.md ## +-- tab_active.Rnw ## +-- tab_counter_stats.Rnw ## +-- tab_elast_mats.Rnw ## +-- tab_elast_sum.Rnw ## +-- tab_est_set.Rnw ## +-- tab_est_set_elasticity.Rnw ## +-- tab_est_set_extended.Rnw ## +-- tab_est_set_ols.Rnw ## +-- tab_est_set_panels.Rnw ## +-- tab_profit_by4tile.Rnw ## +-- tab_profit_by4tile_extended.Rnw ## +-- tab_quintile.Rnw ## +-- tab_regs.Rnw ## +-- tab_regs_elasticity.Rnw ## +-- tab_regs_elasticity_activeweight.Rnw ## +-- tab_regs_elasticity_types.Rnw ## +-- tab_regs_extended.Rnw ## +-- tab_regs_without_hh.Rnw ## +-- tab_sumstats.Rnw ## +-- tab_value_regs.Rnw ## +-- tab_value_regs_active.Rnw ## +-- tab_value_regs_coeff.Rnw ## +-- tab_value_regs_coeff_shift.Rnw ## +-- tab_value_regs_diff.Rnw ## +-- tab_value_regs_set_average.Rnw ## \-- tab_value_test.Rnw TBA
